title: What date is the General Election 2019 and how to get a postal vote?
text:
There’s still time to apply for a postal vote before the next General Election this year (Picture: Rui Vieira/PA Wire)

Boris Johnson won a vote to hold a general election before Christmas yesterday as MPs voted in a huge majority of 418 in favour of the bill on Tuesday 29 October 2019.

The Prime Minister announced that he wanted a pre-Christmas election because there was a need for a ‘new and revitalised’ Parliament able to deliver Brexit for the new, extended deadline of January 31 2020.

So now that it has been confirmed there will be a General Election before Christmas, when is it and how do you get a postal vote to ensure you have your say?

What date is the General Election 2019?

The General Election before Christmas will take place on Thursday December 12, meaning voters will go to the polls in six weeks time.

The decision to hold the General Election on December 12 came after Labour lost an amendment earlier in the day to go to the polls three days earlier, on December 9.

The date set for the General Election means that a new Prime Minister will be declared on Friday 13th December.

Speaking after the result, Boris Johnson told reporters it’ll be a ‘tough election’ and said it was time for the country to ‘come together to get Brexit done’.

How to get a postal vote before the next election

If you are eligible to vote in the next election then you are eligible to apply for a postal vote, you don’t need to give a reason as to why you want one.

To register to vote by post, you need to download, print and then fill in an application form from the gov.uk website.

You don’t have to vote at a polling station if you apply for a postal vote. (Picture: EPA)

Postal votes can be sent to addresses in the UK and abroad.

Once you have filled in the form, you need to return it to electoral registration office, the details of which can be found at yourvotematters.co.uk.

You must return your postal vote application form by 5pm, 11 working days before the poll. This means that for the General Election on Thursday December 12, your postal vote application form will need to be returned before Tuesday November 26, 2019.

For more information about applying for a postal vote and to download the relevant application form, visit gov.uk/government/publications/apply-for-a-postal-vote.
